author: rich
title: NFT-DAO EZ-on
description: Writing safe DApps today is too difficult and developers lack tools to easily build composable components.

assessments.note:
Problem needs to be solved:
Lack of tools and complexity to develop DApps efficiently is a serious entry burden for developers to enter DApp building and making use of NFTs.
The proposal doesn't contain a tangible solution proposition. It seems the proposal tries to solve the majority of the problems that DApp development poses today, yet there is a lack of a concrete (partial) solution proposition.
Community benefit:
If the vision of the proposal is achieved mainly projects migrating from ETH would significantly profit from an easy way into Cardano.
Ability to scale and address challenges:
Contracting of MuKn and IOG is pointed out, which would allow for scalability. However, it is not clear if the contract of MuKn and IOG is an intention or if there's already agreements of cooperation with these organizations. It is not clear if the team can rely on these contractors or of they are at risk to lift the project on their own.

This challenge is well expressed and the technical expertise is vast. The solution appears to be feasible and the stages presented look promising results. This project has the potential to help build the Cardano ecosystem to the next level once smart contract launches and the benefits of this solution will help many interested in the space to have a working structure in which to build upon.

There is nothing in this proposal that is improving Cardano's dev ecosystem in a meaningful way. The proposer fails to make clear how building contracts in Glow with MuKn is going to grow the ecosystem.

This proposal has nothing to do with Cardano developer ecosystem and is for the completion of smart contracts in the glow dsl. From the start of this proposal the author leaves the reader confused as to what they *are actually* building.

The relevant experience of 5 team members are presented, which cover mainly entrepreneurship and software engineering. Sources for verification of this information are unfortunately not provided. There is also the possible availability of a big cohort of 113+ NFT enthusiasts, yet it is not clear how many of those could be engaged and what experience they would bring. The availability of the contractors MuKn and IOG is not clarified.

Since there is no well defined scope of the proposal both in deliverables and timeline, it can't be said if the budget or timeline are sensible.

Given the breadth of experience and expertise collaborating in the team its highly likely the proponents can deliver on their solution. There are existing example of their work and the ability and interest in expanding with Cardano can benefit the projects vision and the community's collaboration.
There is no technical documentation, no metrics, no detailed project plan or any other basic required info needed for a complete proposal.

The project plan is too high level, the phases read more like a research project (and for a dApp not a dev resource) and the technical documentation describing how this resource will function is entirely missing.

The provided roadmap has no measurable metrics, timeline or associated costs provided.
The provided link to the "schedule and funding" leads to a website saying "coming soon" and doesn't provide a reliable source of information, since it could be edited at will. There is no other information available to what contributes to the cost of the project that is asked for in the proposal.
The linked github page has multiple repositories. However, there is virtually no activity on those at the time of writing except for one that has all commits spread over 2 days and multiple commits are done redundantly (same commit message and description).
No metrics have been provided that would allow to check progress of the project or it's success towards the Cardano ecosystem.
The problem has been stated understandably, I couldn't understand the solution clearly though.
There seems to be no risk assessment or possible challenges reviewed.
There are metrics, roadmap and stages to the plan along with multiple collaborators and clear vision of success. It's a solid proposal.
This proposer at no point makes it clear how partnering with MuKn and their Glow DSL framework is going to scale Cardano's dev ecosystem.
This proposal is lacking detail on top of not at all belonging in the developer ecosystem challenge to begin.

solution: Partnering with MuKn.io/Glow to make building infrastructure fast, easy to write and audit to onboard developers new to the space.
experience: MuKn.io/Glow brings skills of cybersecurity, cryptography, distributed systems, systems programming, economic modeling & mechanism design.
